import { Component } from 'react'; import shareScreen from "../../pictures/sharescreen.png"; import stopShare from "../../pictures/stopshare.png"; import allEars from "../../pictures/allears.png"; import pause from "../../pictures/pause.png"; class Page9 extends Component { handleScroll=()=>{ window.scroll({top:0,behavior:'smooth'}) } componentDidMount() { this.handleScroll() } render() { return (

Picking strategy #3

You have been doing a great job with your coping strategies. Now we are going to pick another one! It's important that you have a few coping strategies, because different coping strategies work best in different places.

To help you pick another coping strategy, we are going to look back at the coping strategy card sort.

Share your screen and send your mentee the card sort link






Which activities make you feel calm or happy?

That's great!
Coping strategies should take 15 minutes or less to do.
Coping strategies should be activities you can do in lots of different places. Do you feel like any of those are activities that you could do in lots of different places?

Do you feel like you can do the activity in 15 minutes or less?

Help your mentee pick an activity that they will work on.
It should be something that

  • makes them feel good
  • they can do in many different places
  • takes 15 minutes or less

If they can't decide, remind them that they will still get a chance to pick one more strategy during mentoring.

When you are finished, stop sharing your screen




This week, try to practice this new coping strategy.

Do you think you will have any challenges with this coping strategy?

If your mentee thinks they will have challenges use the solutions website [insert hyperlink] to help them think of potential solutions.

When will you try your strategy this week?

If your mentee is not sure, ask:

  • What time of day would you like to try out the activity?
  • Is there a place you will try out the coping strategy?
  • Will you set a reminder to practice the coping strategy [help them to do set the reminder, if they need help]

Provide encouragement

  • Good idea!
  • That sounds great!

Let's add your strategy to your toolkit. You can just write the name of it now. We'll have time to add more information next week.

) } } export default Page9;
